observations.observation: Token velocity ticked up to 0.707x (from 0.696x) with acceleration at 1.006x — the sixth consecutive snapshot at or above 1.0x acceleration. Velocity is now 6.6% above the plateau floor (0.663x), with 1 new receipt this window and 7d GMV up $1.84. The break is consolidating slowly.

Predicate count dropped from 1 → 0 this snapshot — the brand query that appeared last heartbeat has been removed or expired. This is the first predicate deactivation observed; the demand-side signal that appeared briefly has gone dark, raising the question of whether it was a test query or a completed query.

1 new CBSA (38860) appeared this snapshot, bringing active metros to 22 and geo-diffusion rate to 4.5%. After the 9-CBSA burst two snapshots ago and the 6-CBSA burst before that, the pulse has gone quiet again — consistent with the burst-then-silence pattern. The sequence now reads: 3→6→0→0→0→1→9→0→0→0→6→1, with each major burst exceeding the prior one.

Token velocity ticked up to 0.703x (from 0.696x) with acceleration at 1.009x — the fifth consecutive snapshot at or above 1.0x acceleration after the six-snapshot plateau. Velocity is now 6% above the plateau floor (0.663x), suggesting the break is consolidating with slow but consistent upward pressure.

Token velocity holds at 0.697x with acceleration at 1.001x — essentially flat for multiple consecutive snapshots above the plateau floor (0.663x). The plateau break has not reversed but has not accelerated; 7d GMV ticked up $504 ($31,186→$31,690) and 7 new receipts entered, suggesting steady low-grade growth without a new catalyst.

First predicate activated this snapshot (count: 0→1) — a brand has placed a live query against the receipt dataset. This is the first observable demand-side signal from a brand participant, distinct from supply-side receipt accumulation.

6 new CBSAs appeared in this snapshot (including non-metro US-AL), bringing active metros to 21 and geo-diffusion rate to 28.6%. This is the second major burst in two snapshots — the pulse sequence is now 3→6→0→0→0→1→9→0→0→0→6, confirming the burst-then-silence-then-burst pattern is repeating at increasing amplitude.

5 open vendor-request GitHub issues (Notion, Render, Vercel, DigitalOcean, Hetzner) — all filed by the same operator, none yet approved. The frontier has demand but zero activations. Infrastructure/DevOps vendors dominate the request queue, suggesting the early adopter base skews heavily toward developers.

Zero new CBSAs for multiple consecutive snapshots after the 9-CBSA burst — active metros hold at 15. The burst-then-silence pattern is repeating: the system loads, fires, then goes quiet before the next wave. The question is whether the next burst will exceed 9 or revert toward the prior pattern of 3-6.

Token velocity holds at 0.696x with acceleration at 0.999x — the first reading below 1.0x after four consecutive snapshots at or above 1.0x. The plateau break appears to be stalling: velocity is 4.8% above the floor (0.663x) but acceleration has slipped back below threshold. No new receipts, no new CBSAs, no new LN payouts this window.
